characters: A HALF BILLION FOR YOUR INVESTORS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the conversation continues we see:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. A MAID clean an expansive living room, waxing a mahoga table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2. A BUTLER open sliding doors to an empty grand sitting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3. An overhead shot as a SERVANT carries packages up a lo winding staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They lived through the Depression, Pearl Harbor, and the Bomb. And they didn't think bad things might happen; they knew they would happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what's happening now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid my favorite teacher was Mr. James. Mr. James said that world events always revolve around five things: (extending his fingers one-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And right on cue, we see for the first time -- ROBERT MIL (60) -- sitting on a sofa across from MARIA BARTIROMO and CAMERA CREW, mid-interview. ELLEN MILLER (58) watches on nearby MONITOR.

dialogues.speaker: M-O-N-E-Y.
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was this freshman econ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was fifth-grade econ. (smiles, off her laugh) But this is something we've seen over and over again, time and time again, that competition for this-- limited amount of dollars out there, can make even the best of us manic. So it's not surprising that we see these asset bubbles, but when reality sets in of course, they burst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we push tighter into the plane, cutting into the engi as we hear a sonic boom and focus inside, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sleek, slate-gray cabin, divided into three seating are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the back of the plane, five AIDES DE CAMP chatter in h tones, pouring over a sea of red-inked paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the galley, GAVIN BRIAR (42), pours a coffee. He bring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: who sits alone in his private area facing the cockpit, scribbling his own red-ink across a stack of CONTRACT DOCUMENTS. His effortless slouch, silver hair, and all- commanding mannerisms make one thing clear: Robert's our

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him the coffee) Here you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert sips it. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quants? Derivatives structures? What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It makes no sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said last week. Why'd we go down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did we sign?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. We did not. Instead I fly two thousand miles for a marketing meeting... And where was Mayfield? What was this "emergency"? What was that about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Did you speak to the auditors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if... we don't don't close this week...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push into a close-up of Robert, as he contemplates wha this would mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of thirty million dollars landing near tall gras

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert walks down the passenger steps onto the tarmac, followed by Gavin and the aides. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They approach a waiting MERCEDES MAYBACH. The aides hand BOXES and BRIEFCASES to the Hispanic driver, RAMON, who l them into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blur of city lights as the limo passes over bridges a towards the city and Park Avenue and finally approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous turn-of-the-last-century Stanford-White-desig red-brick MANSION- two already-giant townhouses combined. Robert and Gavin exit the limo and head inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our first glimpse of Robert's home, and it doesn't disappoint. It's an 1850's Tudor given a full once-over, maintaining period details but updated with a Modernist flair. It actually works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERVANT takes Robert's briefcase from him as he enters, handing him three small PRESENTS which he puts under his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR sounds of a DINNER PARTY complete with CHILDREN laughing. Hold on Robert's face- some mixture of exciteme and anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A party in progress, dinner already served.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated around a large square table are: ELLEN (58, Robert wife), BROOKE (28, Robert's daughter), PETER (31, Robert' son), TOM (Brooke's boyfriend), ANNE (Peter's wife), and THREE GRANDCHILDREN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen's playing with one of the kids. She sees Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, your grandfather's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids clamor for Robert's attention. He moves around t table, hugging them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys! Goldenrod - 4.17.11 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Grampi! What did you bring us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert hands out the presents, and the kids unwrap them i frenzy. He continues making the rounds until he finally g Brooke and Peter, seated next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace, but we notice clear restraint, a marked con to his behavior towards their kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your birthday, Dad, not theirs. You're spoiling them rotten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my job! It's my job. You guys turned out fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debatable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Peter, as they hug and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', son? Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert rounds the table and takes his seat next to Ellen she discreetly waves to the SERVANTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to eat. The kids were starving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hugging her, happy) No, no that's okay. Where's my drink, is this mine, here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SERVANT enters with a CAKE flickering birthday candles. Everyone notices and starts CLAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert smiles. They finish cheering, then CLINK glasses f toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, thank you, thank you all very much, it's such a surprise, I didn't even know it was my birthday!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs a little. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Mark Twain say about? He said-- old age... is clearly a case of mind over matter. If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've done a lot of things in my life, worked very hard, but being here, looking around-- at all these shining, radiant faces, I know that my best work is right here in this room, right now... I'm deeply proud of all of you. That's the best gift your mother and I could have hoped for,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: so, thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and to have sold the company to Standard this morning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, too, Peter, but- no business tonight-- no business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here we go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More group LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although your one-track mind assures me you've got not only your mother's genes, but you've got mine, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More LAUGHTER. Robert laughs, too. He sees Ellen hug Pete across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I'm aware that may seem uncharacteristic, but maybe it's taken me sixty years to realize what's truly important -- and it's you guys so thank you all very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they applaud) Hear, hear! Goldenrod - 4.17.11 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A warm, clubby room, kept traditional. Robert pours out t SCOTCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids are wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about me as a mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no no, you should have-- I want more "you's" around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert brings the drinks to the banquette where Brooke re with an open FOLDER. He resumes signing papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all about you, isn't it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four... and nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke nods, tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last time you made a speech like that we lost the Firestone bid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... I just... wanted it to be about the family tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods again, unconvinced, then pulls out a MAGAZINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks closely at it. A "Forbes" cover story:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Robert Miller, the Oracle of Gracie Square: Investor pro in uncertain times by predicting housing crisis." Goldenrod - 4.17.11 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Yeah... Oy. You know how I feel about that. Trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's got a copy pinned up in the conference room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sits back, takes a drink) Well, you gonna keep skirting around it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke leans back and stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why sell our company? We make a great return, we give money to the causes we believe in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My darling, you are still in your 20's. I am 60. That's a big difference in point of view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, you're not that old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It catches up alright. And maybe there's some other things I'd like to do. Maybe I would like to spend a little more time with you guys... outside the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke shoots him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring at him, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to imagine what we would do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is supervising the yawning children as the party wi down. She sees Robert put on his OVERCOAT. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I gotta finish up that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds a beat, then approaches and straightens his col

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, I haven't given you your birthday present yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back as soon as I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her and starts to exit. She stares as he walks Hold on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TAXI stops in front of a large frosted-glass apartment entrance. Robert exits, paying the DRIVER through the win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Yeah, Gavin, it's me, uhh... When you get this -- I want you to call Chris Vogler at Fremaut, tell him I need to see him right away, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE CГ”TE (32) sits at the head of a marble table in th exquisite space. It's the modern mirror of Robert's mansi the lines carried through fully this time. And Julie is t modern woman: sleek, fit, and flowing, even at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's intently focused, handwriting personal notes onto a of INVITATIONS for the "Julie CГґte Gallery - Paintings b Rodriguez - April 10th" as she downs the last of a WHITE She's got a seating chart out that she's working on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INTERCOM RINGS. Julie heads over, sees Robert's face the VIDEO MONITOR. She holds a beat. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert waits in the cold, staring into the camera as Juli watches him from inside the loft, not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a second, the door BUZZES open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters. Julie is already back at the table, writin She's arranging 4 POLAROIDS of different paintings on a w along with a SEATING CHART. He walks down the long hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes up behind her, running his arms across her stoma

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (standing in frustration) Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses to the open kitchen and pours out more wine, lights a cigarette. Robert trails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I'm sorry. I'm sorry I'm late. I'm always late-- you know that-- and I'm sorry. And I'm always saying I'm sorry about being late. (crosses to her) It doesn't mean I wouldn't rather be here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other as she drags off the cigarette, stubs it out. He gestures to the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The show's gonna be beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slight beat, then

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares, still in the moment. Then she heads to the fr and slides out a homemade BIRTHDAY CAKE. He stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow, that's great. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made this for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made this? This is amazing. One candle, thank you very...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for the cake, grabbing a piece of it with her hand and... SMEARS IT ONTO HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension breaks, and they LAUGH. He grabs her and they kiss furiously, pulling at each other's clothes as she pu him backwards into the bedroom and they begin to make lov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. GREENBERG & COMPANY - OFFICE HALL - THE NEXT DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters the palatial quarters, decorated with ornat 18th century furniture. As we'll see soon, it's a stark contrast to his functional empire. He follows a striking British RECEPTIONIST down a long hallway passing a massiv glass conference room. They arrive at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist escorts Robert in. Standing to greet him JEFFREY GREENBERG (53), handsome and charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Diane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits. Robert sits. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what's not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey, I told you, I'm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...working on it," yeah. Well, while you're doing that, lemme tell you what's not working...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what's not working is my four hundred twelve million dollars that's sitting in your account so you can pass your audit, the four hundred twelve million that you needed, you said, for two weeks, and which has been languishing now for (looks down at paper) thirty-two days, while it could be elsewhere invested, earning an actual return, instead of couching the absurd lie that you're spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you're gonna get a signature from Mayfield, and that my hostage money and my fee are going to be sent to me promptly, say... by tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am solving the problem. I am getting you your money and your fee. You will have them very shortly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as they sign the contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm not the one with the liability, pal. I just made a loan. You're looking at jail for a thousand years for fraudulent conveyance and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Stop it! You don't have to talk to me like that!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get you into this mess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a friend of mine!... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...remember when you asked me if it was a good idea to divert half your liquid assets into a fucking copper mine? What did I tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands, heading to door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we done here? I think we're done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeffrey stares at him contemplatively for a moment, then appears to reach some sort of conclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friday morning I take my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the fuck I can't, it's in an escrow bill with one-day call rights...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I need the money there until they sign, Jeffrey. What if they check again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really not my problem, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares, fumes) Not your fuckin problem...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Robert as he storms the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And enters his waiting limousine, SLAMMING the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off. Robert turns on the TELEVISION. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOW continues its uptick this morning on new housing starts to rise 132 points. Asian markets fared less well, especially in Russia, where further nationalization plans caused foreign investment to sputter, leading to various...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Robert, trying hard to contain his building rage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His phone VIBRATES a TEXT, from Julie: "See you at 8!" He stares at it, breathes in deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CARPHONE rings: "Gavin."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty tonight at the Four Seasons. We'll get it straight with Mayfield then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming a little) Good. Very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stands tying Robert's TIE in front of a dressing mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this too blue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the third one you've tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finishes tying it. He looks in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ay, yay yay. I look old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look regal, and wise, and granted a little worried. What is going on? Are you afraid of this meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They haven't signed the papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that's why you flew down there. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his eyes) So did I, but for some reason they're stalling. I didn't get any sleep on the plane and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now come on. It will all work out. Just follow the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What plan is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Confidence equals contract."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound like a fortune cookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're your words, actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you married an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but I was thinking, idiot, that, after the deal is done, which it definitely will be, why don't we just take off? Pete's in the best place he's ever been, your daughter is always as brilliant, right? So, I wanna have some fun. I wanna have fun with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her softly, but stays silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to Ravello- the house there. We haven't been there forever..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There hasn't been time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to make time. We go for a year. Let's take a year and get fat and have fun and go on an adventure. I mean-- seriously-- how much money do we need?. Do you wanna be the richest guy in the cemetery? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He straightens his jacket, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna be in the cemetery!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, Mary called from St. Victor's Hospital, again, she said they still haven't gotten the check yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm taking care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gala is Friday. Should I be selling my ring? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had to move some things around for the merger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's only two million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walks up to her, laughs) Only two million?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember-- Riccio's? Full meals... two bucks... all you can eat... three bucks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do remember. But I do not remember you being so sentimental unless you were trying to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he heads out, smiling) I don't know what you're talking about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen slaps his behind. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Gavin ride, both shuffling papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert trails Gavin up the stairs as he types out a TEXT MESSAGE to Julie: "Wrapping up mtg- be there soon."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAITRE'D spots Robert and greets him as he approaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller, good to see you, sir. Your party has already arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Robert and Gavin into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we see Brooke and Peter seated with a group of EXECUTIVES including AIMES (45), and BARNES (43).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Displeasure immediately registers on Robert's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto, to Gavin) Where the hell is Mayfield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin shakes his head. They approach the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they sit) Mr. Miller, thank you for coming. We were just getting acquainted with Brooke and Peter here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope they didn't beat you up too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been terrific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, we've been talking about operations. Tim thinks once we consolidate we can save about fifty percent on our back-office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert phone VIBRATES. It's "Julie" calling. He silences Goldenrod - 4.17.11 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to hear about that, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had thought Mr. Mayfield planned to join us tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim should be here in twenty minutes; he suggested we get right into details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just telling Brooke: now that we can market your quants' track records, we have access to a host of new capital that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert drifts as the suits prattle on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The execs are still chattering. Robert is sweating. Julie calls again. Robert silences it again. Then he gets a tex "9:40pm - FUCK YOU."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...assuming we shed debt through some small liquidations, I'd say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, gentlemen, we've been here nearly two hours now. Where is Mr. Mayfield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just texted me. He's very sorry, but he's been detained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detained where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I think I can leave you with my family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Again, Mr. Miller, a privilege. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert refuses Aimes' hand and heads out. Brooke rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the bullshit way you try to close a deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Port? Would you like to have some port?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brooke catches up with her father in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get my message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found some strange entries in the "Old Hill" books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of entries?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure yet, but there's definitely something off. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, come by about eleven tomorrow and we'll look at it then. And Brooke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can find out what happened to Mayfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 26 She nods, as Robert dashes down the hall. 26

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. JULIE CГ”TE GALLERY - A LITTLE LATER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert exits his MAYBACH in front of a big scene in progr trendy FOLKS overflowing into the street, cameras FLASHIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space is cavernous, modern luxe -- a Liagre design wi thirty-foot columns and slab granite. The ART COLLECTION display is indeed beautiful- photo-realist paintings -- a each one tells a strange story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters and scans the room. No Julie. He approaches gallery ASSISTANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Everyone loves them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but how are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So-so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the party further. No Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Julie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pick up on Julie bumping two rails of COCAINE. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dressed in a burnt red, form-fitting Lanvin dress, coiffed, perfectly made-up-- if we didn't suspect anythin we'd think she was the precise image of New York art-worl success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie pulls her hair back and straightens, enters the mai gallery...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she quickly sees Robert searching for her through t crowd. She stops dead, considers going back into the offi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she stands firm. Robert finds her eyes. He stares at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares back, with a simple look that says, plainly: "Go away."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and heads off to talk to a group of PATRONS, including the painter VICTOR. One of the group is a DASHI YOUNG MAN- is he flirting with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert approaches, staring at the young man, then at Juli She's all smiles, but she doesn't immediately introduce h He stands there, until--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... (to the group) This is Robert Miller, one of our collectors. This Katrina Stanton, and Alex Stanton and their daughter Ava, who is a talented young artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert shakes hands with the group, exchanging pleasantri especially kind to young AVA (15).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really? Painter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drawings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie begins to walk off, disappearing into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's great. (as he notices Julie leave, to the group)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the size of the paintings, I wanna talk to you about them in a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert trails Julie, moving up to her quickly. He reaches to touch her and she spins towards him violent, definitiv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go -- away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie heads back to the buyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dismayed, Robert takes a last glance, then recedes out towards the entry desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the gallery assistant he was talking to ear and picks up the buy sheet at the desk, marking some piec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will take

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: those two. And the Rubik's cube on the back wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to list) Right there, number seven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell her it was me. (off her nod) I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert walks out and hails his driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Robert, in bed with Ellen who is asleep. He gets up a stumbles to the bathroom, puts on a robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He approaches the basement level carrying a folder of papers... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And sits at the counter, staring at a REPORT of some kind refills a glass of SCOTCH, downs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's a touch worn from the evening, but she's still composed. She sits with five guests including her gallery assistant, the HANDSOME YOUNG MAN from earlier, TWO WOMEN and TWO GUYS who look like painters. One does a line of COCAINE off a "Fantom" magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...fucking Dalwood wouldn't know a Van Gogh from a Van Eyck. And they call it a "State of Contemporism..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's phone RINGS. She looks at the Caller-ID, (which s her home line calling) confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert watches Julie through a crack in the doorway. He's her CORDLESS phone. We INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in your bedroom. Can you get those people out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look down the hall. Do you see me? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so I'm serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and begins to clear out the guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert sits, unbuttoning his collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guests finally leave. Julie heads to the bedroom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And finds Robert sitting, looking a little too comfortabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just come in and out whenever you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we should talk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, then in a rage) One damn night in a month I told you was important to me, et tu es meme pas capable d'etre la...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I was working, do you understand? I'm under enormous pressure, I have obligations...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't want to hear about your obligations. If you cared -- YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there! I was there! I was late, but I was there. And I'm here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. You're here when it's convenient for you to be here. C'est pas ca l'amour. Love means

dialogues.speaker: YOU FUCKING SHOW UP
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert follows her. They stand at a great distance as she downs a red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you buy those paintings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I liked them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face falls slightly, but she keeps her grace -- and her anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, thank you for helping me get started. But if I'm gonna fail-- then let me fail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, you're not gonna fail. Why would you fail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm not the kinda guy who wants to throw money away but if you wanna start a business, you have to project a certain image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What image?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Success.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market's a disaster right now; nobody's moving anything. That's why you gotta show sales. People look at you then and they say "Whoah, how'd she do that?" -- and that's what they remember. Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him, laughs a little in devastation, then.. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're never gonna leave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Robert's face as he stares at her, silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is on the bed, holding herself, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert comes up next to her, hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come away with me. Let's just take your car and go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Where?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place upstate. Very beautiful, on the water. We can wake up there together- just you and me. I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's keeps crying, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MERCEDES 450 SEL driving the interstate towards Connecticut. Billie Holiday sings her 1959 "Just One More Chance." We hold on a two-shot through the windshield: Ju rests her head on Robert's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the camera moves closer into Robert's face, Julie snu next to him, Billie's music lulling the moment into tranquility, and finally, just finally, Robert has a mome respite, as he slowly closes his heavy eyelids, nodding o into a trance of desperately needed sleep until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCRAPING METALLIC NOISE jolts us back to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reality -- as the car drifts into the CENTER MEDIAN where the tire catches on a small metal SCRAP and BLOWS OUT, flipping the car over and over until it CAREENS to a halt Goldenrod - 4.17.11 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's eyes flutter open as he comes to, groggy. He's b injured, but breathing. He starts to feel his body. Movem returns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is instantly obvious she is dead: she's been nearly decapitated, a deep gash ripping through her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shock, followed quickly by panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a DRIPPING sound. A gas leak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert reaches into his pocket and dials 911... He looks the phone just before pressing "Send"... and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to open the door. It's stuck. He KICKS at it. It

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags himself out of the car. Stands. Smoke is still rising from the smashed hood. He pulls up his shirt. A DE BRUISE: a broken rib from the steering column. He winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a few steps forward, moving around to the passen side. He looks again at Julie. Horrific. He reaches out t touch her, then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on his face. He sinks to his knees, putting his head his bloody hands. He SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he rises, and begins hiking to the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert walks and walks through tall grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance behind him, A MASSIVE EXPLOSION lights up sky in a fireball as the gas tank finally catches, incine the car and its contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert cleans himself up in the sink, applying soap and w to his cut stomach, scrubbing frantically, He takes all t paper towels and puts them in his pocket. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert picks up a PAYPHONE by the bathrooms, cradling it his ear with his sleeve and dialing with his other finger through his shirt fiber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I wanna make it collect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your name, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence Grant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RINGING, then...

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: JIMMY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to listen to me very closely...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE CARS flash lights. An EMT unloads Julie's charred CORPSE into a BODY BAG. INVESTIGATORS sift through rubble

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DET. MICHAEL BRYER (43) sits in a TAN SEDAN, drinking a c of deli coffee. Barely awake, he stares out the window at bunch of STATE TROOPERS arguing with his partner, MILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MILLS breaks away from the uniforms and approaches, shaki his head. Bryer gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be fucking kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catching detective wants us to rule before he calls it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been having the same fuckin' argument for twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't handle one drunk motorist kills herself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure about this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer heads over to the car, his interest piqued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills shines his flashlight towards the passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Car roll had multiple impacts, but she was here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and her feet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: were down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer immediately sees what he means-- dented metal, even the burnt door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... So who kicked out the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer bends his head down to the car's passenger side, looking off into the distance of the path Robert took jus moments before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About twenty yards down the road, a BLACK SUV hums, waiti Robert opens the passenger door and gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside is JIMMY GRANT (23), Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to drive. Jimmy looks over at Robert; he's pre banged up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna tell me what this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's better you don't ask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all you're sayin' is, you need a ride somewhere. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to be very clear about this: you called me to give you a ride. I'm giving you a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not. We're not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no? Then where the fuck are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're both alseep right now. At home. Which is where you left your phone, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if anyone checks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is anyone gonna check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not, as long as we're not here. Anybody know you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody knows you're here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But somebody knows-- you're not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my girl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, you call up two am, what the fuck you want? She asked me where I was going. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her I had to run out a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you trust her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the kinda shit you used to do to my dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you trust her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I fucking trust her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. So you're at home, and I'm at home. My wife gets up at five am for Pilates -- I will be there next to her, where I've been all night. And you'll do the same with yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy exhales a long sigh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is some pretty fucked up shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, come on, I don't hear from you since the fuckin' funeral, you call me up out of the blue, using my father's name, ask me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what do you want, you want money? I will give you five thousand dollars! I will give you ten thousand dollars! I'll give you whatever you fuckin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy swerves the car to the side of the road and stops. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna talk to me like that you can get the fuck outta my car and you can walk! You want that?! You wanna fuckin' walk home?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Listen... I'm sorry. I'm not myself. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy waits a moment, then re-enters the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert winces in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert is holding his side. He pulls up his shirt. Jimmy the awful purple bruise from the steering column.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, man! We gotta get you to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I just... have to get home... I'll deal with it in a couple of hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you don't make it a couple of hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I don't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV stops a few blocks from Robert's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the window) Call me, alright, and let me know it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he exits) Better we don't talk for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe it-- through the window) So what you get in a bind and just call up the only nigger you know? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert looks at Jimmy, eyes tearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jimmy. I really am. Just go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright, man. Take care of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's car drives off. Robert hobbles up the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters the basement. He runs into a security monitoring room. We see a street view of cameras outside door he just entered. He pulls DISCS out of VIDEO RECORDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands in front of a bin marked INCINERATOR. He is wearing a new T-SHIRT and SLACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He places all of his bloodied clothes and the video discs into the incinerator, pouring LIGHTER FLUID on top of the Staring at the clothes, he notices one cuff link is missi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strikes a match, setting the items on fire and closes hopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he exits the burning area--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert turns, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine, Glen. Go back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The servant shuffles off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert quietly undresses, leaving on the white UNDERSHIRT presses at his rib, winces again. Then he gets into bed a stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you go? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I woke up for a minute, you weren't here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just went to... eat some ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained, shifting his body) Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Don't forget to take your Lipitor in the morning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still love me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls over. Hold on Robert's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYD FELDER (64) sits next to Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypothetically, the situation you're describing would be involuntary manslaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And such a person...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...would be in a lot of trouble, especially if that person was closing a merger with a large public bank where any publicity or arrest could delay or derail the transaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's only if there was some evidence that could link him to the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fingerprints, DNA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very hard to collect after an explosion. The real world's different from television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about cell phone records?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did this person make any calls from the area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from a cell phone, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they won't be able to place him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you advise such a person to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To confess immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Failing which?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To put as much distance between himself and the event as possible, if possible. But let me tell you something, and I'm speaking to you as a friend now: there are about fifty things that person wouldn't have thought of. And the more time that passes, the more lies that are told, the worse it gets for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to come to you. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An accident's not the worst trouble. If we talk to them now we can probably work it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me what happens if the Standard deal does not close, and I gotta tell my investors about our real losses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what'd you say about the Justice Department? Depending on what they decide to arrest me on-- fraud conviction gets me twenty years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs in pain) What choice do I really have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow CHRIS VOGLER (52) through the busy lobby out to street. He crosses Park Avenue and gets into Robert's lim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert opens the Percocet bottle, downs four PILLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris enters and sits. Robert mimes a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're aware Congress plans to extend the audit requirements for private funds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am aware. I gave testimony to the committee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Standard wants to prepare for it now. So I was asked to go through every one of your trading books and reconfirm their assets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Absolutely not. That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I put the team on different books and I left "Old Hill" for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, I'm here to tell you-- I cleared it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audit's cleared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The report will be issued today. Actually, I'm calling it my "swan song."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, on Friday, it's a five-year clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh.. To prevent exactly what we're doing. But honestly, there's nothing left to worry about. It's -- great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carphone RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How was it? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The show, Julie's show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... Oh, it was fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Robert rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mayfield's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here? Where?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sherry Netherland. Checked in about an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He called?

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No, Brooke has a friend on the executive committee who said he's taking meetings in his room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's settling in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we're dealing with a fucking idiot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spoke to legal. They said Standard will sign once they get the audit report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's being issued now.

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind that, just find out why Mayfield hasn't called us. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 39.

dialogues.speaker: GAVIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How am I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I have to do every Goddamn thing myself? JUST FIND OUT! WILL YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and exhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track through a Spartanly-furnished trading office: hi design with lacquer and muted mahogany. PEOPLE at COMPUTE make phone calls. CLOCKS show different time zones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke sits across from Robert. They're reviewing papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot reconcile it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reconcile what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Old Hill" Fund. Dad, are you listening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, those trades are in the special book. They don't get audited on the same balance sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but look at the sheet! It can't be right. There's a four hundred million dollar hole here. I mean that can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Det. Bryer enters the glass doors and badges the RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bryer. I was hoping to see Mr. Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the way that this sheet reads, half of the fund's assets are missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous. That can't be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, it's ridiculous, and yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll look into it. I promise you I'll look into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Intercom handset RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: There's a detective Bryer here to see you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stiffens, then into phone) Give me two minutes, then send him in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, my other meeting just got here early. We'll have to pick this up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. And Mom wants to know about the hospital check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke, we'll pick it up later, alright? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke exits. Robert steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Detective Bryer, hi, I'm Cindy, Mr. Miller's personal assistant, right this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Brooke exits, she and Bryer cross paths. She eyes him. He doesn't look familiar. Off Brooke, curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert leads Bryer towards two sofas where they sit oppos each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm sorry to keep you waiting. You can sit there. We just heard about it. Really terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you were an investor in her gallery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through... I think it was a charity function. My wife and I have a foundation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. When'd you last see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night, at the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you stay till the doors closed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think I left about ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you go? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go straight home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer shifts, edging forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay, so now, back to the gallery. Did you see her with anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See her with anyone-- what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know like a boyfriend, someone she might've left with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I noticed. No. No, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reason I ask, is, that we haven't located the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, someone else was driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes, the driver, will go for help-- and he'll die tryin', you know... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is awful. This is truly awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're searching the area right now. So no boyfriend that you know of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually we didn't talk about personal matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was just an employee, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well not an employee. I was an investor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you invest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I invest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why'd you invest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a great eye. She found me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: those Bryce Marden's there. They went up in value very quickly, and on the basis of that I agreed to fund some of the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Would you mind if we searched her apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in your company's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Yeah. Of course. Sure, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Mr. Miller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you lease an apartment for Ms. CГґte? Is that something you normally do for your employees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I said that she wasn't an employee, but-- I think she'd just come over from Paris if I remember, and she needed a place to entertain buyers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you leased her this apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was through our holding company. You seem a little confused by all this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am. But I'll get there. Gimme time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I don't mean to be indelicate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're going to be indelicate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, from what I've been able to gather, she wasn't exactly an art star. I mean, she worked for a couple a dealers in Paris, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay, I get it, so why would I invest in her and help her find a place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very simple, detective. I invest in people I believe in. I thought she'd do well, so I backed her, she did. It's is simple as that. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, stands as Robert

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that seems to make sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're all good with the apartment, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert shows him to the door. Bryer turns back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to your head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a nasty cut; I've been looking at that for the last five minutes. Does it hurt you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touching the cut) Oh, no, I just hit it on the medicine cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate when that happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for the chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer heads out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Robert as he closes the door and winces in pai Goldenrod - 4.17.11 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A serene khaki suite with high-post windows and white upholstered furniture. On the walls are gala posters from various charity events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAE (30s) sits at a reception desk typing. The phone RING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen Miller's office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen's standing, cradling the phone and packing her hand Across her desk, SUSAN (30s) reviews the guest list for t hospital event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it, it transformed them, seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a Detective Bryer in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen holds up her hand, buying a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thanks again for your generosity. Alright, we'll see you then. Thank you, bye. (hanging up, to Mae) I'm sorry, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Bryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen smooths her suit and puts her bag over her shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading to the door) Well, I'm late so-- I just can't deal with it right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what about these? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send them a thank you note, Zappos has been so generous-- Thanks, bye guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen exits the building, passes the doorman and then Bry who is waiting in his car outside the multi-unit townhous where she keeps her office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't notice him as she passes and enters a TOWNCAR She's about half-way into the car when he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after her) Mrs. Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows his badge) Detective Bryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you just call my office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was hoping to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't have time right now, sorry..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on the charm) Just take a couple a seconds. It's about your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, fine, but, make an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door and rides away. Bryer smiles in frustration, walks back to his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Ellen's face as she tries to keep it together, shakin Goldenrod - 4.17.11 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FORENSICS TEAM sweeps the apartment, collecting fingerprints, rug samples, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills supervises from the side. Bryer approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the wife blew me off-- which was interesting. And he didn't admit to the affair, but then he wouldn't, would he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you pick him up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a very rich man. What happened with the pay phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills pulls out a SHEET from Verizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got about fifteen calls in a three- mile. Two of `em look a little strange: got an incoming-- that's probably a local drug deal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the one we care about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Collect call. About a minute and a half. Made from the Chevron station on West Lake Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who'd he call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cellphone in Harlem. Still waiting on the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks, gets up and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're at the crash site. Alright, and... you make it outta the car. Now... You're smart enough not to use your own cellphone. So you get to the pay phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and you're a billionaire, right? You're a billionaire-- so whaddya do...? (Mills shrugs for the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call someone in Harlem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert is heading down the hall towards the elevators. Ga jogs up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Robert, I just heard about Julie... I'm so sorry. Her Gallery called. Her mom's flying in today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (managing a nod) Her Mom...? Service here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow at nine am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we should pick up the expenses for that. Whatever she wants. You'll take care of that personally, for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You reach Mayfield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELEVATOR arrives and Robert gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, but we'll get him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Appreciate your concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin's still staring as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEDESTRIANS hurry by this busy stretch of Upper Manhattan Goldenrod - 4.17.11 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer and Mills wait. Jimmy approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's flash him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive up on the sidewalk, blocking Jimmy's path, and Mills exits the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NYPD Homicide, would you mind stepping into the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the window) Just get in the car, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I under arrest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the window) You wanna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sits across the table from Mills and Bryer. They sh him PHOTOS of Julie's burned body at the crash site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's do this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, for what? My answers ain't gonna change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's a wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you accept the charges on a collect call from a wrong number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I wanna answer any more questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you stay on the phone a minute and a half on a wrong number? What the fuck do you talk about, area codes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to my lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, kid, we know you went out there. We ID'd your photo with your neighbor who saw you getting into your truck ten minutes after this call was made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you got all that, what the fuck you need me for, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you understand the gravity of the situation here, Jimmy. This is a homicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert rides with Syd. He reviews a DOCUMENT entitled "MAPLE LANE TRUST - James L. Grant - Beneficiary."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert signs the document, closing the folder. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna sign him out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called in Earl Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basketball player?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civil rights attorney. You remember Crown Heights?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the best?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the best above 96th Street- and that doesn't make him any cheaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert slumps back, staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta get Jimmy out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might not be that easy. If he doesn't cooperate they're likely to indict him on obstruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would he be looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to say. With his prior... Five years, maybe ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy stands at the counter as EARL MONROE (50s, Black) s papers. Bryer waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not going to go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy ignores him and exits with Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and Earl exit the buidling. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tomorrow if there's any news. Don't worry about anything. And don't talk to anyone else. You take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy nods and walks up the street towards Syd's limo in distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy enters. The limo drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you said was you wanted a fucking ride! You didn't tell me you killed that girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to put my life back together. Okay, I appreciate you helped us, but now you're pushing it too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like it was your ass sitting in there? Like you know a fucking thing about how it's gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got you the best criminal lawyer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Don't you got your own son for this? Why the hell you didn't call him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause he woulda fucked it up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I'm sorry your son's a fuckin' idiot, but that ain't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't productive. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. So tell us then, Syd, what happens now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We meet with Earl and we go from there. I understand that right now they don't have enough to charge you with anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your under suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under suspicion? Motherfucker, I'm Black!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am aware of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what exactly would you like me to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (BUZZING the driver) Gentlemen, my driver will take you where you wanna go, but I cannot be a party to this conversation, so this is where I get out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd steps out of the limo and watches as it rolls away up Tenth Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't you have just stayed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have responsibilities. And if I stayed there, a lot of people would've been hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody was hurt. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other people, Jimmy. I've got business troubles, you understand...? People rely on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy chews on this, dissatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen... I want to talk to you a second. Come here. I wanna show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy slides over to sit next to Robert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, you know, your father asked me to look after you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know I messed up, alright? I'm sorry. But I do want to help you, you know that. (handing Jimmy the folder) So I've been able to set up a situation for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
