dialogues.text: It's a trust. In your name, assets of $2 Million dollars. Take a look at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? You think money's gonna fix this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy laughs, then rises and knocks on the limo's partiti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Yo, yo man, pull over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at him) What are you gonna do? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look like a fucking snitch to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Jimmy. I don't know. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy laughs in disgust, begins to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait. Sorry. Just-- read it. Just take it home and read it. It's not gonna hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy grabs the document and gets out. Robert stares ahea into space. His CELLPHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CINDY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I've got Chris Vogler from Fremaut accounting, you asked me to interrupt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, put him through... (he hears Chris come on) Chris...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Robert, I've run into some problems. We're doing a "non-recommend."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: They got compliance involved. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris...

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I've gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris? CHRIS! Goddamnit, Chris! Goldenrod - 4.17.11 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke sits alone in the accountant's office we saw earli She reviews SPREADSHEETS on his COMPUTER and compares the with PRINTOUTS from a FILE CABINET that she has broken op

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numbers from the screen reflect across her reading glasse she stares in disbelief. She DIALS a number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...? I'm looking at some statements right now... How much did you book last quarter?... No, I'm not... No, Peter, I'm really just asking you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking at an entry on the screen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Miller Capital Management - PETER MILLER GROUP - $68.3MM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-five million. For your entire group, right?... It wasn't sixty-eight?... Of course it's a big number... No, I'm not... Oh, Peter I'll talk to you later .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke taps the keyboard and a PRINTER spits out pages. Suddenly, BEN (40s), an accountant we saw earlier, appear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in my office?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke bolts up, startled. She collects the papers she printed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up pages) Can you explain these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Explain what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Hill. All the numbers you've falsified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what you're saying. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke nods, heads to the door. Ben put his arm on her shoulder to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting my arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you just leave it alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him. He drops his arm. She exits and turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired, Ben.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't fire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think asked me to make those changes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares, then approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 You tell me. 83

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer and Mills sit with Flores as he stares at a SHEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was doing a little dealing a while back, but it looks like he stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, they're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's a good student, magnet school, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then his mom dies and he gets popped for gun possession. Even so, how come he got probation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he had an excellent lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck does this kid afford Felder and Chausse...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills drops another FOLDER on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pulled his parents' tax returns. Guess where his father worked for twenty years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miller Capital?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the fucking driver?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, this guy's good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts down the sheet and leans back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you at with the kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far he won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well he's a convicted felon. Go get a warrant, put him in front of a grand jury. Let's see how long he holds out when he realizes he's looking at ten years off the prior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert storms the hallway, passing a waiting SECRETARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Miller, as I explained from downstairs, he's on a call right now, and he said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He brushes past her. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters, locking the door behind him. Chris bolts u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert comes closer. Chris is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what's going on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert GRABS Chris by the collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean it's not...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slackening his grip) The audit passed? What do you mean the audit passed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It passed! It passed a week ago! Like I said. Everything's fine! We confirmed the money, it's all straight and done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then... why did you tell me that it didn't? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they asked me to hold it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They? Who's they? (thrashes him again) Who is they?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayfield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert thinks... and starts LAUGHING. Chris looks at him strangely as he walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're negotiating. He wants a better price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert exits the building with what looks to be, for the first time in the film, a real smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks towards his limo, DIALS his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sherry Netherland...? Yes, James Mayfield, please... (as he enters his car) Mr. Mayfield... I think it's time we had a talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer walks with DEFERLITO (48), who rifles through a FOL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cause it's not gonna hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The warrant doesn't need to hold. It just needs to scare him into giving up Miller. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Mike, you're stalled- out mid-career so you're reaching for a high-note? Who gives a fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is about Judge Rittenband, isn't it? It's cause he's running again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna cost the Judge his seat on a profiling claim? Against Earl Monroe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting a piece of new evidence that'll seal it a hundred percent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, then come back when you got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have it before you go in the jury room... Look, Ray. We like this kid. I don't wanna lose him. Think about it: if we flip him, you get Robert Miller. What's that worth to Rittenband, and to you for that matter...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years, Ray. Twenty fucking years, we watch these guys- they out-lawyer us, they out-buy us. I'm fucking sick of it. Where's the consequence? The guy did it. He does not get to walk just cause he's on CNBC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deferlito stops, stares, then signs the ARREST WARRANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks off. Bryer holds a beat, then pulls out his CELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I need a serious fuckin' favor... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters, moving much slower. As he approaches Cindy sees a worried look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke's waiting for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we have a meeting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but she looked upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters. Brooke's at the window in a chair. It's cl that she has been crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweetie, you okay? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke holds out her hands. She has two copies of the "Ol Hill Fund" balance sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands there a moment, staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Brooke and Robert from overhead like little dots a they cross 5th Avenue towards Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk solemnly towards a park bench in front of a lak Robert sits, motions to Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna sit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stand. (as he sits) Didn't you think I'd find out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why didn't you tell me? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I hoped you wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on. You tell me the truth now -- or I am done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I made a bad bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you committed fraud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a dangerous word, Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you prefer? That you cheated? That you stole money from people who trusted you? That you lied? That you lied right to my face? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we were going broke! Everything was finished. We'd have nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How. How does that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Alexanderov? Well he came to see me one day last year. He said "Robert, we've got a great opportunity- there's a copper mine, it's in Russia, it's under- exploited- there's billions under the ground, and to get it out, all we need is a couple hundred million, you put in a hundred, we'll put in a hundred- we'll triple it all in six months." So, I go check it out. And the geological survey's right, friendly government. And to lock it in, you hedge it, right? Sell the copper ahead on the commodities exchange and it all works, it's fine, and you're making a fortune. (beat, then real fast)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then there's something I hadn't accounted for-- variation margin-- and that friendly Russian government all of a sudden not so friendly anymore and they're blocking the export of the copper so I gotta make it up, I gotta put the cash in to cover the hedge. But I'm not worried about it because it's still springing money, there's so much money coming out of the ground you can't believe. You can't stop it. And, yes, I'm the oracle, I've done housing, I've arb'd credit swaps, I have done it all, and yes, again, I know it's outside the charter, but it is FUCKING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until it's not... The money's trapped. You can't get it out. Probably never will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a plane crash. It just happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it does not just happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just happen, honey you are so naive sometimes. It HAPPENS. And like every father I pray that it doesn't HAPPEN to you, which, thanks to me, it probably won't happen to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to you, we may all be arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's getting arrested. That's why I borrowed the money from Jeffrey. Plug the hole, I put it there for a month, they see the books are fine, I transfer the company, I pay back Jeffrey-- with interest!-- make all of our investors whole, and what's left we keep. At least we get to keep the house. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the company sells. If I lie for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to lie. You didn't know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the Chief Investment Officer of this company. What do you think they'll say at the depositions? "She didn't know?" They'll take away my brokerage license- failure to supervise you -- my name in every paper and blog while I visit your ass in jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you want me to do? Did you want me to let our investors go bankrupt? Is that what you wanted? For people to get really hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... gives you the audacity to think you can make those decisions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's my job!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's illegal. It's illegal. And I am your partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are not my partner! You work for me! (off her bewildered stare) That's right. You work for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody works for me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a moment in silence. He looks at her destroyed expression. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke. Brooke. Come here. Please? Please. Just, just come here. Just for a second and sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I wanna tell you. And whatever you decide I won't blame you... (she turns to look at him) I'm on my own path. It's up to you to move with it or against it. But I'm the patriarch; that's my role. And I have to play it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares a while, then) For a moment I thought you were gonna say you were sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Robert alone in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy approaches the building. Bryer exits his sedan and walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, take a ride with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? Back to the station?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man, just get in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I say no? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not threatening you. I'm just asking you -- take a ride with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy considers, gets into Bryer's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive a while in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, man, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's pretty fuckin' simple. I know you went to pick him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you wanna talk about? I told you I ain't makin' no more statements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I know why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this. (hands him a case folder) I've got his phone calls, I got his text messages. I've got the relationship with the girl. And they were fucking, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I've got you. I've got the time log from the pay phone. I've a got a fucking tollbooth photograph of you driving your car through the Triborough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy thumbs through the FOLDER. There's no tollbooth PHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you got that...? That's bullshit, cause I didn't do it. That's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's silent. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lied to me. You lied to the police. You obstructed justice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to Earl, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck Earl! You see this? (holds up the grand jury

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This means that tomorrow, grand jury hears your case in court. And tomorrow in court I'm gonna ask for a felony obstruction indictment, and with with your prior, you are going to prison for fifteen fucking years... You might get out in ten. You'll be what then? Thirty-three, with no job, no girl, no life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer pulls the car over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look: I know you think Miller's your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Miller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know about your father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then hard) You don't know a Goddamn thing about my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Miller paid his bills while he was dying. I know he got Syd Felder to get you out of trouble on your gun charge. That doesn't add up to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, he's driving, he crashes- he runs away- who does he call? Calls you. Why do you think that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Cause you're disposable- you're the one person he could call that just doesn't fuckin' matter. You're a- you're a throwaway. You're just another part of his transaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to open the locked door) Will you open the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, what? You're his new nigger now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy grabs at the door violently. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open-- OPEN THE FUCKING DOOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't kill that girl. He did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (containing his rage) Will you -- open -- the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's using you. I know it - you know it. Do the right thing. Now get outta my fuckin' car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer unlocks the door. Jimmy exits and walks up the bloc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nearly empty. Ramon, the limo driver, plays Solitair a COMPUTER. Robert sits with Syd in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're certain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courts aren't for certainty, but he says he was at home, why shouldn't he be? A phone call doesn't make him a liar. (off Robert's nod) But what's baffling to me, though, despite your sentimental history together, is why you would put your family's future in this kid's hands. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a good thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, plays with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands and collects PAPERS into his BRIEFCASE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Ellen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's good. Fine. (stops packing, looks up) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She met with Gil Deuchman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The estate lawyer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Has she mentioned anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jimmy in the witness box before 23 GRAND JURORS. T prosecutor, DeFerlito, asks questions. Earl Monroe sits n to Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the early morning of April 11th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You received a phone call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who called you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy stares at DeFerlito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lie, isn't it, Mr. Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stayed on the phone one-and-a- half minutes... Mr. Grant, isn't it the case that you know exactly who called you and exactly why? Why are you lying to this court?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeFerlito turns and walks back to the prosecutor's table. picks up a PHOTOGRAPH and hands it to a CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to introduce into evidence People's A. This is a toll booth photograph taken in the northbound ninth lane of the Triborough bridge. Mr. Grant, directing your attention to the photograph, would you please read the date and time stamp indicated on the lower right hand corner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy stares at the photograph in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers in Jimmy's ear) You're gonna have to answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant, please answer the question. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: April 11th, two thirty-three am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant, directing your attention to the same photograph, would you please read the license plate number of the vehicle passing through the toll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D D G five five four two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing in another sheet) This is People's B, a printout from the Department of Motor Vehicles plate registry... Mr. Grant, directing your attention to that printout, are those numbers on the toll photograph the same ones that are on your own license plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's still staring at the picture. Earl watches, conce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Grant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, the numbers are the same?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you explain that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that is your car in this photograph, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that is not your car? (off his silence) Answer the question, Mr. Grant. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not my car in this picture. I don't know how you all did that, but this is not my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect this grand jury to believe that that is not your car when there is a printout from the department of motor vehicles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's asked and answered, Mr. Deferlito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Monroe, you are aware that you're not permitted to go on record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy bursts out of the courtroom doors trailed by Earl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy. Jimmy-- what was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, now here's what...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Earl can finish responding, Bryer exits and walks to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can halt the decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a minute, Detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you, Jimmy? You need a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy doesn't answer. Bryer sits down next to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause if you do we could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get the fuck outta my face. How `bout that?. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you wanna keep playing games? Or you ready to tell me something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective, I need to talk to my client. Now if you would just please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you- How you all just gonna lie like that? Huh? How you all just gonna lie?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't lie. You lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jimmy, don't say anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure it wasn't. And it was a telemarketer called you from the pay phone? He stopped at the Chevron to make a late night sale?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That picture was some bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Jimmy, stop! Detective, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, tell him. Go ahead, Jimmy. Tell him. See how the boss'll like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl stares at Jimmy, waiting. The bell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy's silent. Bryer shakes his head and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising, to Jimmy) Wait here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer and Earl enter the courtroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldenrod - 4.17.11 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy, as he stares out the 11th floor window towards Brooklyn. In the distance, the Woolworth building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About thirty people in a room too big for them. At the fr are tasteful flower BOUQUETS surrounding Julie's CASKET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters and spots some of the people from the art opening, including Julie's gallery assistant. She looks a him quietly, then quickly looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no organized service; people are just walking up the casket and saying prayers. Robert takes his place and holds a moment at the casket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gallery assistant comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Miller. I would like to introduce you to Julie's mom, Sandrine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful woman in her 50's, SANDRINE, sits crying. Rob approaches as she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so, so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, then) I just wanted to thank you for what you did for my daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head softly) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believed in her, and you gave her a chance. She was happy. I know she was happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: not fair, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sandrine starts to tear. Robert moves in and HUGS her, ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shouldn't have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Sandrine's face, in pain. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Brooke's legs, running on a treadmill. Ellen exercises on a STAIRMASTER next to her. We hear the sound Ellen's small talk begin to fade in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...she's rail thin. She's a blond. I would not have known who she was if she hadn't come up and introduced herself to me. She looked totally different... and... (notices Brooke increasing the machine's resistance) You're going straight to level six don't you think you better pace yourself a little bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fakes a smile) I'm good. I wanna run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay with you and Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you worried about the deal closing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to guess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brookie, come on, don't be silly, tell me what's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooke stabs "Stop" on the machine, quickly cooling down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heading to pick up her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I can't stay for breakfast I have to just... I have to get in to work, I don't know what I was thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you uh, finish the deal with the hospital? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he write the check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen stops her machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Issues related to the closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't lie to each other, Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying to you. It's complicated; you wouldn't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen crosses closer to Brooke blocking her exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I know that a policeman showed up at the office? Do you know what that's about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your father's head- where he cut his head and the pain that he's hiding in his stomach and, now (starts to tear) For some reason that's way to complicated for me to understand, there's no money for a routine gift? Does that seem a little strange to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me what's happening. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to say? He's my dad. I have to trust him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You have to do what's right for you. Not him, not me, not anyone. This is your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen grabs Brooke and hugs her hard. Brooke hugs back, kissing her mother on the cheek, tearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Ellen alone as Brooke exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAMES MAYFIELD (50s) waits alone at a table. Robert enter They shake hands, then sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep sending people to my office to "do business."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just getting acquainted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the intricacies of my operation so that you can... not buy it? (to a waitress as he sits) Just coffee, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what it was like on our side of the fence. Everything just moves... a little slower. Plus this whole audit mess doesn't help. You know, clearing that all up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FUCK - YOU. I'm the Oracle of Gracie Square. You came to me. I did not come to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, I think we're getting off on the wrong foot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Forget it, forget it... Forget the deal. I don't even care about the deal. No, I run a comfortable -- excuse me -- I run a THRIVING business, that has returned year-to-date 15.4% percent to our investors, or approximately $583 Million dollars from a trading operation that you don't have and that we both know that you need, or else you never would've called me in the first place. You on the other hand, you've taken a salary of (sotto from the waitress pouring his coffee) 18 Million? (returns to volume) And what have you delivered? A falling stock price of negative 14 dollars? Is that what it is? You've also lost approximately... THREE AND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just calm down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so we issue a press release today, say there is no deal, never was a deal. You're not gonna be buying Old Hill, you're not gonna be buying Quantum- you're not gonna be buying anything; You? You're just a browser. Now, me? I'll continue to enjoy my earnings, and while I SOAR on princely wings, to my next winning enterprise, your stock drops another couple bucks on yet another - failed - acquisition - attempt. Bodes well for your tenure, doesn't it? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your price is too high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a nice day, James.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four-fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five twenty-five. That's it. Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if it's no, send any further communication right to my trash can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extending his hand) It's a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One other thing -- six months and I'm gonna be gone. I'm outta here. My daughter's gonna take it over. You know her, you trust her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna have to make my son a VP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. He doesn't have to do anything, he just gets the salary, he gets the office. Both of `em on five-year employment contracts, and my lawyers draft them. Yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert pulls out a pen and jots down the deal points they have just outlined onto the paper menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm writing the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ripping off the tablecloth) I'm serious. I'm very serious. Sign it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayfield thinks a moment, then reaches over and signs the Robert does the same and then folds it into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll send over a draft of the press release.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Robert stands to go, he clutches his bruised rib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine... Before I go -- how much would you have paid...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six hundred. And you would've taken...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four seventy-five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we made a good deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he heads away) Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert turns back to the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I lied. I would've taken four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayfield shrugs and returns to his paper. Robert walks ou the restaurant, beaming. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Gavin, and many of the various STAFF we have met a gathered around a long conference table. Robert stands at front of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Anyway I will be seeing most of you at the gala tomorrow night. But as the sale's official as of this afternoon, you are now free to talk about it. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we get new business cards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, everyone but you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, it's a great day. Your hard work made it happen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all clap as Gavin and Robert exit the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how'd you make Mayfield come around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met his price. I just took it out of your share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. Now go get me that fucking hospital check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gavin walks off. Robert's cell RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's not good... Goldenrod - 4.17.11 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert heads through a dark service entrance towards a buzzer, then down a long hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reina, Jimmy's girlfriend (24, Hispanic) stands at the do with Robert and Jimmy. She turns and heads to the bedroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy heads to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any milk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy starts running the tap. Robert notices the moving B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was planning on Virginia, but it looks like I'm not going anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy returns with the water. Robert take a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You waiting for me to say something? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to take the toll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said "Listen to what I have to tell you and follow my directions, listen to me closely, do the following just like I say."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You said all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you took the toll anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jimmy, don't fucking lie to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not lying! I took ninety-five all the Goddamn way there. I did what you said: I didn't stop. I didn't take the Triborough. I followed all your fucking instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where'd they get the photograph from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying... it's a fake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get so fuckin' rich again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be such a wiseass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is my fuckin' life, man! Earl's telling me it could be ten years? Ten fucking years! How much are ten years worth, Robert? (off his silence) Goldenrod - 4.17.11 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look man, I told you, I ain't no fuckin snitch, but this is bad. This is real bad. Reina and I got a whole plan we're about to make happen next week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Jimmy sits) What plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got money saved up; I'm buying a business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought an Applebee's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's an Applebee's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fucking restaurant, man, it's a chain restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bought an Applebee's in Virginia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this really what you came here to talk about? What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not really that simple, Jimmy. I'm in a situation now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you... right now, if I were to speak, a lot of people would get hurt. Jobs, families. A lot of innocent people. Do you think you can understand that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but what about me? What about my situation? (off his silence) They showed me pictures, man; that's fucked up what you did. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yeah, I know, all the people counting on you, whatever, but -- you told me Earl was gonna make this right. Now you know I care about you, all the things you did for us, and for my father, but Earl said they're offering me a deal, no charges at all. I walk away. They just want to know who I went to pick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you putting me in this position, man? Why are you putting me in this situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you just hang tight? Just a little longer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, man, but Earl said the deal's on the table for twenty-four hours. After that, they're filing the case, and Earl says we're gonna lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, stands) Alright I hear you. I'll be back with you as soon as I can. Just hang with me a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy nods. Robert walks out. Reina crosses back into the living room as he approaches the door and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta give him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was to keep quiet, not to go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he offering you now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can he offer me? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reina crosses to Jimmy and hugs him as he starts to cry, wipes away his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The limo drives down Fifth Avenue. Robert's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: We went to the toll authority. They said they gave the tape to the cops. I've requested our investigator go examine it at the evidence room, but honestly what's the point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he didn't take the toll.

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And you believe him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Does Standard have clawback?

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: What? What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say I decide to go in...

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just listen, listen to me. If I were to surrender, now, could they roll back the deal?

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (after a beat) No, what's done is done. There's no intent to defraud. You haven't warranted any behavior. So it's just money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years, you think?

dialogues.speaker: SYD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: At this point- I dunno, they're not gonna make it easy.... I really suggest you think about this. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the DA, get it started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert hangs up. He stares out the window at Central Park

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He enters the foyer and ascends the steps to his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Ellen. He looks at his watch: "8:34PM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves over towards the bed and dials the tableside PHO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Glen. Did Mrs. Miller say where she was going tonight...? Aha... No, I'm sure... I'll try her cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clicks off and DIALS another number, hears Ellen's voi mail come on the line, and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exhales and lies down on the bed in his clothes, stari at the ceiling. He lies motionless a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he sits up, thinks, and shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He quickly picks up the phone, stabbing at the keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd...? Yeah- Did you make that call to the DA yet...? Thank God. No, no, no. No. Listen to me, call Earl, tell him to get his car, tell him to meet us at my house in twenty minutes... And, Syd...? Bring a notary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A steady stream of CARS passes through the toll. We follo BLUE LEXUS as it approaches the far right lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl Monroe pays the TOLL CLERK through the window, getti RECEIPT. Then he pulls his car to the side of the road, p at a BUILDING labelled "Port Authority - Administration." Goldenrod - 4.17.11 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a LAPTOP on the passenger seat, typing numbers f the toll receipt into a little box on the screen. A porta PRINTER spits out pages. Earl stamps them with a NOTARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl waits at the front desk of the drab government offic BRENT, a balding man in his 30's, approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi I'm Brent Owens, the night supervisor. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing him some papers) Hello, Brent. I'm Earl Monroe. I'm executing a criminal evidence request. I need to get a look at one of your lane tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brent looks over the papers, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. This says you want to look at a tape made ten minutes ago...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Syd stare ahead, silently. Syd tries to say so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up his hand) Wait. Wait. Just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 121 Syd slumps back. They keep staring at nothing. 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RAPPING noise on the window startles Syd, who rolls it down, sees Earl, and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl climbs inside, removing a FOLIO from his breast pock as he talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, they won't release tapes without a court order, but they did give me a print out, the same kind they used at Jimmy's indictment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl reaches inside the folio and removes the PHOTOGRAPH got from the toll authority. He lays it on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from a toll camera, showing his car and license plat Goldenrod - 4.17.11 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lexus- that's your car, your plate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got Jimmy's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd lays the PHOTOGRAPH we saw earlier of Jimmy's car goi through the toll onto the counter next to the one Earl ha just placed there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert picks up a high-end MAGNIFYING GLASS and leans ove look at the two photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the photograph of Earl's car, moving slowly through it left-to-right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then he scans the photograph of Jimmy's car, passing left right until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes back by the license plate area and stops --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lines around the license plate of Jimmy's car are all slightly-pixelated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He switches back to the plate on Earl's car. The lines ar fine. Back to Jimmy's. Pixelated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert puts down the magnifier, straightens, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl's dark laugh cackles across the soundtrack as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earl sits across from DA Deferlito and Bryer. JUDGE RITTENBAND reviews both TOLL PHOTOS with a MAGNIFYING GLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well they look a little different to me, too... Is there a reason you haven't allowed Mr. Monroe's investigator to conduct his own analysis? Goldenrod - 4.17.11 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had some issues regarding chain-of-custody...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You don't have them anymore. You're to meet him with the evidence in the next hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I not speaking loud enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems there's been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Let him tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know where it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not in the evidence locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Rittenband leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll ask you one last time, detective. Where is the tape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) We lost it. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm... In light of these developments, and I would think you should be very happy to hear this, with Mr. Monroe's approval I'm going to offer Mr. Deferlito the opportunity to voluntarily dismiss the indictment to save us all a bunch of embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel comfortable with that, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Further I'm going to put all charges against Mr. Grant under seal. (Bryer starts heading to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This case is dismissed with prejudice and it is not to be refiled. HOLD ON, Detective. (Bryer stops.) If you have another suspect in the automobile death then you are to present him, but Mr. Grant is free from any further inquiry in this matter. This is over. Do I have your understanding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deferlito gets up angrily, huffs past Bryer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close the door, detective, please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bryer closes it. The judge holds up the toll photos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finessed these, didn't you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You finessed it. I know it, and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you're after. I saw all the evidence, not just the toll photo. You gotta get him the right way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay. (approaches the judge) So let me get this straight: What you're telling me is I'm supposed to sit around with my thumb up my ass and my fingers crossed hoping that one of these fucking days, somewhere down the line, one of these rich assholes is gonna say the wrong thing LOUD enough so that we can't choose to ignore it anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck outta of my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, your honor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mills waits on a nearby bench, watching as Bryer exits th chambers dialing his phone. DeFerlito walks up to Bryer, grabs him. Bryer breaks free, aggressively, phone to his Mills approaches. Bryer waves him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Well when do you expect her...? When do you expect her? Okay, well so I don't have to call a ninth time, will you take down what I'm sayin', word for word...? Okay, you got a pencil? You ready? Okay, here goes: "Mrs. Miller- Exactly how fuckin' stupid do you really think I am?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Jimmy sit. Jimmy looks at the TRUST DOCUMENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't hurt anybody. You helped a lot of people. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this piece of paper makes everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it makes it easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worried I'm gonna say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy keeps staring at the document.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, look: you asked me to come meet you and I'm here, but I came because I wanted to get something straight between us: we're even.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we're even. But just for the record though, what you did... (picks up the trust document) Was way beyond the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's beyond money for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the document) And if I take this, then what does that say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks a moment, then folds the document and puts it i his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. I'm gonna take your money and do something good with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen is dressed in a full BALL GOWN. She sits at on the finishing a drink. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert enters and begins changing into a TUXEDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie. What time you wanna get there...? I don't wanna get there too soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't say anything. He waits a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tying his tie) You okay? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spoke to Brooke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slows... Something's brewing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She didn't have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I explained to Brooke that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you explained, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell her everything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything? (off his silence) Lift up your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lift up -- your shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and heads towards him. Then she hits him with NEWSPAPER, right at his broken rib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He winces a little, then looks down at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Post article chronicling Julie's death. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell her about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellen I don't know what you think you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't treat me like an idiot. You've been sneaking off to see her for months. You don't think I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never cared, really, about your secretaries, your- gallerists, whores, whatever you wanna call them. I cared about our home. And now you have brought this to our door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did what was necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you did what was necessary for you, Robert, for your interests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For my interests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything I do is for us, for this family, and now you're gonna tell me how to run my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about your business, this is our life! Where do you think we're going tonight? Why do you think I've even tolerated this for so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's had enough) What you've tolerated? Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you find that funny. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? What about the complaints? The unhappiness? The drinking? The shopping? The trainers? Everything! But yes, the charities, the wonderful sainted charities, you know, all the wonderful works that you do. How do you think I've paid for them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you because I didn't want you to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cause you didn't want to give `em up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought that we had an understanding. And you broke that understanding when you brought Brooke into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I kept her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you made Brooke complicit-- when you risked her future-- and I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a FOLDER revealing some legal documents, slides them toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crosses to the bed and puts on his glasses. We see the title: "SEPARATION AGREEMENT" and hold on him reading for few brief seconds until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "All ownership and voting rights transfer to the Miller Charitable Foundation, to be administered by Brooke Miller?" Did you really expect me to sign this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not following. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently not, no. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like talking to a child) Okay, uhm, the police have been trying to talk me. I assume they want to know where you were that night. And you know what? I'm not gonna lie for you anymore. Not unless you sign that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, this leaves me with nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'll find a way to manage. I'm sure you have all kinds of things offshore for a rainy day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fuckin' crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, if you sign, then I'll tell your lie. I'll say you were at home with me that night, all night, together, here, and you'll be free and clear. And the people who need our money will get it. That's my price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your mind. I am not signing that. I will not sign that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then... I'll have to tell them that you came home at four-thirty bruised and bleeding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fucking ridiculous! What... (crosses close to her) Are you trying to blackmail me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we call it negotiating. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna win that one. There's no fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, it'll cause just enough trouble- the kind of trouble that you don't want-- In fact, according to my lawyer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking lawyer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's enough to give them probable cause and then they can subpoena your cell phone, GPS, DNA,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the DNA! I'm sick of this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whatever else they can think of. So really Robert what you have is a choice: you can spend the next three years in court and in the tabloids or-- you can be at your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't do it. You won't do this. You won't do it to the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, trying to make it work, but he can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke -- our little girl's heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's how it all works, Ellen. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do, but she didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll be better for it. The world is cold. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns and heads out) Then you're gonna need a warm coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Robert's face. PRE-LAP Bill Evans' "My Foolish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car rides up Madison Avenue. Mayfield marks up a bunc memos in a leather-bound folder. An aide we met earlier, AIMES, sits nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one more thing... And I hate to mention it now, but I just received it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aimes opens a FOLDER, handing it to Mayfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had Stern Marling run a secondary audit on the Miller financials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch a glimpse of the top sheet as Mayfield reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "STERN MARLING CONFIDENTIAL AUDIT - MILLER CAPITAL - We h reviewed the records you submitted and have found no way legitimately substantiate a recent capital transfer of $4 Million..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hold on Mayfield's face as he tries hard to conceal th spreading realization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who authorized this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) And what did you conclude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you what the paper said, John. I asked you what you thought. Goldenrod - 4.17.11 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat, carefully) Well... what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think... I think... that I don't see anything wrong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayfield closes the folder and places it with the rest of papers. Aimes nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the Plaza Hotel and exit the car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see throngs of the wealthy ascend the steps leading up the opulent hall. Lining the walls are plaques for: "Mt. Sinai Hospital - Miller Oncology Center."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seated at one of the many round tables are Robert, Ellen, Peter, Gavin, Syd, Jeffrey, and a few spouses and attenda Chamber MUSIC plays while everyone eats dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We focus in on Robert as he stares intently out into the room, his eyes a mixture of ferocity and resignation. In distance, we hear a SPEAKER'S voice fade in. It's Brooke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and to receive this prestigious award, I invite now to the stage the man who led this generous effort, and whose financial trading firm, Miller Capital, has just this morning been acquired by Standard Bank and Trust, a dedicated businessman, family man, scholar, philanthropist and all-around humanitarian, a man I am lucky to call -- my mentor, my friend -- and my father -- Mr. Robert Miller...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands against deafening APPLAUSE as he makes his to the stage and, in one continuous shot, gives Brooke a takes the podium, opens his notes, and begins to talk.
